intro: Agalma shweliense, commonly known as the Shweliensis Agalma, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Myanmar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
